sub_title: Senior Technology Leader & Future Shaper | VP of Technology @ MonstarLab
summary:
I'm a dynamic, creative and innovative professional that is always looking for a challenge and understand different software development processes from all perspectives both technical and business.

It's important to understand the market realities nowadays and enthusiasm in learning new technologies/practices helps me to stay relevant with latest trends. Practicing continuous ideation and critical thinking to assess existing solutions and processes, understands what do business really needs at this moment and use the full stack knowledge to implement/advise what would fit best strategically and financially.

My main background is Software Engineering, Databases and Infrastructure. DevOps is more about who I am and how I do things and cooperate with people. My current focus is to engage in AI and AR technology to be ready to drive businesses into the next (or actually the present) step of evolution. 

Total experience:
1 year in AI (Machine Leaning, NTLP, Cognitive Agents) and AR (HoloLens, Unity)
8 years R&D DevOps emerging technologies and architecture.
9 years in Game Development (4 years I was an entrepreneur and working on my own gamedev startups, including SocialNetwork games)

Activities: snowboarding, kayaking, networking, table tennis, rock climbing, bike riding, CouchSurfing traveling, volunteering, golf, basketball, swimming.
Hobbies: technologies, BigData, Blockchain

projects.title: SalesForce Delivery Efficiency Acceleration QAD @ European Telecom
projects.description:
Platform: SalesForce, DX@Scale (research), Copado, GitLab, SonarQube, InfluxDB, Grafana, JIRA, Confluence

Ilia’s assignment in VodafoneZiggo is leading the Delivery Efficiency Acceleration program for the SalesForce implementation, that involves 10 product squads and System Teams. The role is to provide overall governance, execution quality assurance of the project team and strategic direction for diagnosing, identifying and rolling out the short and long term improvements.

Responsibilities:
- Delivery Governance
- Stakeholder and relationship management
- Implementation steering
- DevOps expertise, Continuous Integration and Delivery guidance
- Flow Optimisation
- Efficiency Measurement & OKRs
- Observability

projects.title: Metaverse Future City | Delivery Lead @ Middle East Sustainable Energy & Water Company
projects.description:
Platform: Unity, Azure, Azure DevOps

Ilia’s assignment in NEOM was to delivering an innovative POC in Extended Reality for The Line, focusing on designing the experiences necessary to help engineers to solve specific challenges. This project was led end to end, incrementally evolving the product, demonstrating and validating the assumptions / benefit hypothesis made in the discovery.

Implementing this Extended Reality solution was done with utilising all the knowledge on Delivery Efficiency methods, automation and team level practices and techniques that allowed best of breed quality and receiving customer delight.

Responsibilities:
- Project estimating and composition
- Delivery Leadership
- Team coaching and guidance on Agile & DevOps practices for Extended Reality
- Budget Management
- Compliance and Risk Management
- Stakeholder & Relationship Management
- Proxy Product Ownership

contributors.headline: Senior Technology Leader & Future Shaper | VP of Technology @ MonstarLab

projects.title: Accelerate | Business Agility Technical Coach @ Multinational Delivery Services Company
projects.description:
Platform: SAFe Framework Azure, GitHub, Terraform, FlyWayDB, CA Lisa, K8S

FedEx was undergoing a large enterprise wide Business Agility transformation, and required technical domain knowledge to lead the Delivery Agility space of the Business Agility Framework. First year his scope was helping an Agile Release Train (with 120+ employees on board) to accelerate towards their Path to Production using Cloud Native tools, advanced engineering practices and Lightweight Architecture Patterns. As a result of Ilia’s work, ART became a flagship implementation model, with ability to deliver critical business solutions within an hour End to End.

Second year Ilia moved to another area’s Agile Release Train acceleration where he was focusing on foundation for the Enterprise DevOps Readiness assessment, and guiding the bottleneck identification and improvement recommendations implementation strategy.

Responsibilities:
- Technology Governance and Vision
- Automation Architecture and Vision
- Solution and Program level support
- Guidance to Architecture, Reliability and Quality Engineering to enable DevXOps, Emergent Design and Built-in Quality at scale
- Stakeholder Management
- Technical Coaching on various levels: VP, MD, Mgt, Product Teams
- Collaboration with Internal Shared Services to unlock enterprise wide bottlenecks

projects.title: Reliability Engineering & DevSecOps Lead | Agile Scale-Up Journey Lead @ Next Gen Cloud-Native Telco (Japan)
projects.description:
Platform: SAFe, Artifactory, GitLab, Terraform, Ansible, Grafana, K8S

Ilia’s assignment was to help Japan’s new Cloud Native Next Generation Mobile Network Operator completing their organisational structure set-up and operation readiness for successful commercial launch in Q1 2020. Ilia brought the versatile expertise in Reliability Engineering, Quality Engineering, Automation and Modern Ways of Working on board, helping Rakuten Mobile related Department Leads to organize and evolve their organisations, ultimately leading to the successful operational launch.

Responsibilities:
- Defining the Org Chart, Capabilities and Processes
- Defining and implementing Agile & DevOps Operating Models, Program and Teams Structure
- Establishing Enterprise DevOps Platform Team
- Launching SAFe ART
- Implementation Lead for multiple streams: Agile Scale-Up Journey, Quality Engineering, Technical Architecture
- Stakeholder Management
- Risk Management
- Change Management

contributors.headline: Senior Technology Leader & Future Shaper | VP of Technology @ MonstarLab

projects.title: Serverless Infrastructure & Delivery Automation Architect @ Social Energy Sharing Platform (Utilities Company)
projects.description:
Platform: Azure, GitLab, Terraform, Ansible, Serverless, TimescaleDB, Grafana, AKS (K8S)

Powerpeers is a modern energy sharing scale-up. Customer desire was to prepare for scaling the operations and be able to establish a spin-up of the head company in another countries in the most efficient way, while having the least possible engineering resources. Ilia’s role was to provide Cloud & Automation Architecture expertise to make this desire a reality.

The role consists of two primary areas – designing Infrastructure Set-Up and Automation Architecture in such way, so that it is possible to deploy a SaaS tenant of the same business for another country while preserving connection to the head company and analytics, as well as maintaining customisation ability for different countries / markets. Second role was to set-up and Deploy a SEAL Team of a cross-functional engineers (professionals of the future) who could implement such level of
automation and serverless architecture.

Responsibilities:
- Making the entire business infrastructure and technology ‘as code’, reproducible and scalable on-demand
- Reducing business bootstrap time to 1 day (access, environments, network, security, tools, example pipelines)
- Industrialising experience with assets, reusable automation and continuous knowledge exchange
- Establishing the team, with high level of engineering discipline, cross-functional knowledge and ultimate performance
- Technology, Infrastructure and Automation Architecture vision and guidance
- Stakeholder Management
- Team Lead

contributors.headline: Senior Technology Leader & Future Shaper | VP of Technology @ MonstarLab

projects.title: Digital Defense and Space Manufacturing Company
projects.description:
Platform: Azure, GitLab, Terraform, Ansible, InfluxDB, Grafana, Kubernetes (K8S)

Ilia was responsible for transitioning existing vendor at Thales, who was creating and supporting their enterprise automation platform, based on the Open Source tools.

During that time Ilia was developing new concept of a team with the “Professional of the Future” (SEAL Team). This team was brought from the Netherlands to France to deliver outstanding cross-functional experience: Core Automation (System Team) for the Digital Factory setup.

Responsibilities:
- Transitioned the existing delivery partner to our team in 2 weeks (instead of 3 months)
- Reduce E2E new team’s bootstrap time to 1 hour (access, environments, network, security, tools, example pipelines)
– A newly onboarded team could start coding from within 1h of getting their security badge
- Industrialised experience with assets, reusable automation and continuous knowledge exchange
- Agile Planning, Backlog Management
- Stakeholder, Expectation and Risk Management
- Increased Net Promoted Score from -30 to +90
- Enabled DevSecOps discipline in the program

contributors.headline: Senior Technology Leader & Future Shaper | VP of Technology @ MonstarLab

projects.title: Global DevOps Platform and CI/CD WoW @ Global Telecommunications Company
projects.description:
Platform: Amazon (AWS), Linux RHEL, Docker, Swarm, Anisble, Terraform, Hashicorp Vault, Gerrit, Jenkins, SonarCube,
Git, Selenium, Cucumber, Nexus, ElasticSearch, Logstash, Kibana, Nginx, ZAP (OWASP), Gatling

Ilia’s responsibility was to lead a program that was implementing Fully Open Source Enterprise DevOps platform on the private datacenter - one centralised, containerised and orchestrated solution for the entire organisation. The goal is to build DevOps platform and encourage all branches of the company in all countries to re-use existing solutions and develop the toolset together.

Ilia's main challenge on a non-technology side was to enable R&D practices and culture in the organisation domain that is in its scope and consult/define on necessary methods and guidelines required to help organisation and its people to change.

Application landscape and way of working (development, release) was designed more than 10 years ago and requires to be changed in order to increase agility, speed to market, resilience and aim bring Continuous Feedback to the delivery.

Key responsibilities:
- Thought Leadership
- Risk, Stakeholder and Expectation Management
- Liaising with Leadership on Way of Working Change Management and Vendor Commitment
- Architecting the Platform
- Designing Automation Architecture and new processes
- Open Source project development
- Implementing “Everything as Code” solution, Immutable Private Cloud Infrastructure

projects.title: Agile DevOps Coach @ Major NL Telecommunications Company
projects.description:
Ilia’s assignment was to conduct DevOps and Automation maturity assessments of a program at a CMT company, advise on required next steps to enhance engineering and learning culture, improve on communication and collaboration.

As Agile/DevOps Coach, Ilia was engaging with program teams, coaching on continuous improvement and best practices, recognizing and promoting innovation initiatives of individuals, organizing learning and engineering events (R&D, hackathons).

Responsibilities and commitment:
- DevOps Maturity assessment
- Automation Maturity Matrix across technologies and environments
- Recommended next steps to bootstrap Agile/DevOps transformation and enablement
- Learning plan for people on the project
- Hackathon event
- Involved team members in learning sessions on DevOps tools
- Conducted demo on QA (Cucumber, Selenium) & Performance (Gattling) automation, Version Control Systems

contributors.headline: Senior Technology Leader & Future Shaper | VP of Technology @ MonstarLab

projects.title: E2E DevOps landscape for SalesForce and Vlocity @ Major NL Telecommunications Company
projects.description:
SalesForce CRM is growing in popularity and as world is moving to cloud this CRM is becoming very attractive to our clients. Ilia’s role was to build a DevOps platform for SalesForce/Vlocity delivery and make it a reproducible asset.

Ilia was working together with SFDC and Vlocity dev teams to identify automation patterns and defining DevOps toolset that covers all SFDC delivery areas. Ilia was leveraging usage OpenSource Accenture DevOps Platform, Docker cluster orchestrated with Swarm and replicated in 3 Availability Zones on Amazon with more than 15 tools running in containers there. He deployed and configured this platform, customized it for SalesForce (APEX) and Vlocity (OmniScripts) development and delivery, enhanced with an automated QA - E2E Initial Order Intake, using Cucumber and Selenium.

company.name: 認定NPO法人 Hands On Tokyo

volunteer_experiences.description:
Activity: Ueno Zoo Scavengers (Tokyo)

Childhood experiences are truly invaluable as they are good opportunities to learn and grow, as well as having dreams. But children living in orphanages have few to very little experiences due to tragic and possibly economic reasons. It leads to vast social issues where a few of them live without any dreams and become rejects at schools, which results in the direction of a failing future.

Thus, we offered them a great experience by bringing English-speaking volunteers and enjoyable activities in the Ueno Zoo (Tokyo, Japan). The intention is to motivate children to study English and have actual dreams!

We allow sick or disabled children (from 6 to 17 years old) to experience a special and unforgettable adventure. Control a plane yourself! A day without worries, without illness or disability, a day where they rise above themselves and are more than special, a day they will never forget. More than 10,000 children have been flying in the past 11 years. 900 children flew in 2018.
